text: That's cool- maybe when you've got some time next year you can try out filming your own elements too, it's really fun! Ah things are a little hectic but we're pretty much all working remotely now which is great. Still got contact with my team (through an app called Zoom) and we catch up regularly. Starting a really wonderful new project called Pip & Posy (I think BZ posted about it on LinkedIn), so working on a lot of shaders for that at the moment. I think they are hoping the internship will still run but are going to review the situation at the end of April and make a final call, fingers crossed it continues!

I was also going to mention a cool resource a fellow mentor passed onto me about working from home (which I'm assuming you're doing currently without uni), haven't looked through it extensively but hopefully there are some good tips: <https://padlet.com/Halohello_VFX/remotework>

attachments.title: Remote Working
attachments.text: Keeping your soul together whilst Remote Working

text: How is everything going on your end? Are you putting together a showreel to apply for internships? :slightly_smiling_face:
